history.content:
I recommend Fall 2020: CS 61A, DATA C8, EECS 16A
                    Spring 2021: CS 61B, CS 70, (Dont take EE16B)
You should always the first semester a lighter course load so you know what you can handle. I am myself a transfer and it takes a semester to adjust to the level of difficulty here.

children.subject:
"firmer understanding of them from EECS 16A"

EE 16A isn't a very good linear algebra class and doesn't cover DEs at all. I would advise you skip it if you get credit for 54, or you take the circuit connector class 47D(?). You do need the circuits for 16B, but I would honestly say that if you got an A in your CC LA/DE class, you're better prepared for the non-circuit portions of 16B than most of the freshmen who took 16A.

I'm a former GSI for 16B and we would get so many students who had no idea what a change of basis was. I remember teaching the DE stuff in 16B and using diagonalization in one of my solutions, only to find out that most of the class didn't know what a diagonalization was. I had no time to reteach the concept to them since I had my own ODE stuff to teach, so I got the sense that most of the class was just stumbling through the first third of 16B without really knowing what was going on.

history.content:
Hello everyone, I hope things are going well! I just have a few questions regarding what classes I should take for Fall 2020 and Spring 2021. I am a new transfer student with a firm understanding of OOP from my college, and I have dabbled with data structures (C++) in another class (data structures is offered in two classes at my college and I took the first class). In addition, I have taken linear algebra and differential equations, but I want a firmer understanding of them from EECS 16A. I was curious about some insight on which combination of classes is preferable (workload and concept wise), as I want to declare in Spring and have all these classes out of the way for next year:

Fall 2020: CS 61A, CS 61B, EECS 16A

Spring 2021: CS 70, DATA C8, EECS 16B

OR

Fall 2020: CS 61A, DATA C8, EECS 16A

Spring 2021: CS 61B, CS 70, EECS 16B

Thank you for your time to read this question, and answer if possible!
history.subject: Transfer Student Schedule Recommendations
